data.text: @babs_zone @EclecticRadical @CDCDirector I'm basically just not leaving the house anymore.
@babs_zone I’m getting a haircut rn and I’m literally appalled at the amount of people just going with it so freely tbh
@hand_to_eye The cognitive dissonance is astounding. I really hear you. I feel like I have no choice but to press onward but to where? At what cost?

@babs_zone Per CDC guidelines  last May  suddenly Benlysta was delivered by unmasked drivers. Ppl at blood draw were also unmasked. I have to Uber to medical appointments. I have so many coming up. I feel like giving up.
@jschilltweets we are both still here 😮‍💨🥂 here’s to that remaining the case

@babs_zone Ugh I'm so sorry, but also so glad you were able to leave. I'm not sure what the community defense answer to protecting people still in these jobs is but I'm terrified. But you know what! We're both still here! In abject defiance of everything! I'M PROUD OF US BOTH 💓

@jschilltweets 👆🏻This this this. 👆🏻
That’s why I tried to include those that know covid’s toll— this is one of those costs. I tried to go back to the service job I’d had since 2016 post vax pre delta, but I couldn’t stay. The people were off the wall and my lupus bod had little patience for it.

@babs_zone I'm also very, very concerned about the impact on service/frontline workers. Wearing a mask (or asking others to) at your job already results in so much harassment and now it'll be so much worse.

Like what are we doing? @CDCDirector, you told disabled people, #HighRiskCovid19 that you would be pursuing equity not a month ago. The hollowness of your words, your sincerity, is stupefying. You should be ashamed. #MyDisabledLifeIsWorthy #CripTheVote https://t.co/AlI0aGIhqY
